Short description
(English)
Establishment and application of methods to follow protein dynamics
by 4D live imaging in zebrafish and Drosophila embryos using the
SNAP-tag TM technology.
Abstract (English)
The aim of this project is to establish methods and protocols for
application of the SNAP-tag for live imaging studies in developing
Drosophila and zebrafish organisms. Transgenic animals expressing
different proteins of interest fused to the SNAP-tag will be
generated to image the distribution and the dynamics of these
proteins during organ development using 4D confocal microscopy.
The ultimate aim of the project is to validate the SNAP-tag for live
studies in developing organisms, in particular the SNAP-tagÂ¿s
potential for pulse-chase imaging.
